pullRequest.title: Issue #8901: Run regression testing in CI over openjdk14 or newer codebase
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issue #8901: Run regression testing in CI over openjdk14 or newer codebase
This PR will allow us to parse the entire(almost) openjdk14u repo; all excluded files are listed in openjdk14-excluded.files in the form of BeforeExecutionExclusionFileFilter modules that are appended to the checks-nonjavadoc-error.xml config file via sed when running Checkstyle over the repo.
TODO list:


 After checkstyle/contribution#516 is merged, update openjdk14-with-checks-nonjavadoc-error to have the correct contribution repo link


 Create or find applicable issues for excluded files:

 jdk14u/test/jdk/sun/tools/jhsdb/HeapDumpTest.java
 jdk14u/test/jdk/java/lang/String/TranslateEscapes.java
 jdk14u/test/hotspot/jtreg/runtime/exceptionMsgs/methodPrinting/TestPrintingMethods.java
 jdk14u/test/langtools/tools/javac/annotations/typeAnnotations/failures/T8011722.java
 jdk14u/test/langtools/tools/javac/annotations/typeAnnotations/referenceinfos/NestedTypes.java
 jdk14u/test/langtools/tools/javac/annotations/typeAnnotations/newlocations/AllLocations.java
 jdk14u/test/langtools/tools/javac/enum/TrailingComma.java
 jdk14u/test/langtools/tools/javac/treeannotests/AnnoTreeTests.java
 jdk14u/test/langtools/tools/javac/lambda/speculative/InferStrict.java
 jdk14u/test/langtools/tools/javac/DeepStringConcat.java
 jdk14u/test/langtools/tools/javac/switchexpr/ExpressionSwitchBugs.java





 Create issue to disable/remove checkstyle-cli-run-openjdk14 in travis.sh, as it is superseded by this test.  checkstyle-cli-run-openjdk14 parsed around 2,000 files; and this new test parses around 46,000 files(this excludes module-info.java files and non-compilables):

➜  jdk14u git:(master) find . -name "*.java" | wc -l
49160

nodes.bodyText: Remaining travis failure is due to spellcheck failing on "nmancus", which will be removed after checkstyle/contribution#516
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -53,6 +53,35 @@ guava-with-sun-checks)
   rm sun_checks.*
   ;;
 
+openjdk14-with-checks-nonjavadoc-error)
+  CS_POM_VERSION=$(mvn -e -q -Dexec.executable='echo' -Dexec.args='${project.version}' \
+                     --non-recursive org.codehaus.mojo:exec-maven-plugin:1.3.1:exec)
+  echo CS_version: $CS_POM_VERSION
+  mkdir -p .ci-temp/
+  cd .ci-temp/
+  # activate below line after https://github.com/checkstyle/contribution/pull/516
+  # git clone https://github.com/checkstyle/contribution
+  # need to remove below line after https://github.com/checkstyle/contribution/pull/516
+  git clone https://github.com/nmancus1/contribution.git

nodes.bodyText:
please change extension of file to ".config" to skip this file from any tool that try to validate it.
I do not remember why we named it as ".properties", probably very first version of file was based on properties.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@
+# suppress inspection "UnusedProperty" for whole file
+# suppress inspection "WrongPropertyKeyValueDelimiter" for whole file

nodes.bodyText: bunch of crappy words are leaking to our whitelist, lets exclude .ci/openjdk14-excluded.files completely from spell-checker
please move this to build line to be done before clone of contribution
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -53,6 +53,28 @@ guava-with-sun-checks)
   rm sun_checks.*
   ;;
 
+openjdk14-with-checks-nonjavadoc-error)
+  CS_POM_VERSION=$(mvn -e -q -Dexec.executable='echo' -Dexec.args='${project.version}' \
+                     --non-recursive org.codehaus.mojo:exec-maven-plugin:1.3.1:exec)
+  echo CS_version: $CS_POM_VERSION
+  mkdir -p .ci-temp/
+  cd .ci-temp/
+  git clone https://github.com/checkstyle/contribution
+  cd ..
+  mvn -e clean install -Pno-validations

nodes.bodyText:
awesome hack ! I like it.
I would keep it in mind, it might be handy for other complicated cases also.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -53,6 +53,28 @@ guava-with-sun-checks)
   rm sun_checks.*
   ;;
 
+openjdk14-with-checks-nonjavadoc-error)
+  CS_POM_VERSION=$(mvn -e -q -Dexec.executable='echo' -Dexec.args='${project.version}' \
+                     --non-recursive org.codehaus.mojo:exec-maven-plugin:1.3.1:exec)
+  echo CS_version: $CS_POM_VERSION
+  mkdir -p .ci-temp/
+  cd .ci-temp/
+  git clone https://github.com/checkstyle/contribution
+  cd ..
+  mvn -e clean install -Pno-validations
+  sed -i.'' 's/value=\"error\"/value=\"ignore\"/' \
+        .ci-temp/contribution/checkstyle-tester/checks-nonjavadoc-error.xml
+  cd .ci-temp/contribution/checkstyle-tester
+  sed -i '/  <!-- Filters -->/r ../../../.ci/openjdk14-excluded.files' checks-nonjavadoc-error.xml

nodes.bodyText:
please make it as comment in issue, it is more visible area.
all PR conversations become resolved "collabsed".
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,514 @@
+<!-- This file generated by script at -->
+<!--     https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/8920#discussion_r513557040 -->

nodes.bodyText:
@pbludov , this is not very good approach for CI config.
it should be:
.ci/no-exception-test.sh openjdk14-with-checks-nonjavadoc-error
and in comamnds we do eval $COMMAND
one day this execution will fail in CI in PR, contributor might not be very experienced in CI to figureout how to reproduce it on local, so we will share with him link to single line in config for simple copy and paste in terminal, and it works.
if no objections, lets make issue on this and improve separately.

nodes.bodyText:
Is there a reason these files do not have any reference to an exact or matching folder path?
By specifying a file only, it means we will exclude any file matching that name, especially if there are 2 or more in different folders.
Furthermore why do some have / and others don't? For Windows compatibility folder paths should be [\\/]
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,514 @@
+<!-- This file generated by script at -->
+<!--     https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/8901#issuecomment-712939037 -->
+
+<!-- Excluded due to exception; issues opened -->
+
+<!-- until https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/8945 -->
+<module name="BeforeExecutionExclusionFileFilter">
+  <property name="fileNamePattern" value="/NestedTypes\.java$"/>

nodes.bodyText: Why is this file needed? Why can't we use contribution's file and tell it to target openjdk14 only?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,8 @@
+# List of GIT repositories to clone / pull for checking with Checkstyle
+# File format: REPO_NAME|[local|git|hg]|URL|[COMMIT_ID]|[EXCLUDE FOLDERS]
+# Please note that bash comments works in this file
+#
+# This file has been created to alleviate confusion in the contribution
+# repository's projects-to-test-on.properties file; these projects
+# must be used with special configurations.
+openjdk14|git|https://github.com/openjdk/jdk14|master||

nodes.bodyText:
@romani Note this is using launch and not diff.
Not expecting a change here.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -53,6 +53,27 @@ guava-with-sun-checks)
   rm sun_checks.*
   ;;
 
+openjdk14-with-checks-nonjavadoc-error)
+  CS_POM_VERSION=$(mvn -e -q -Dexec.executable='echo' -Dexec.args='${project.version}' \
+                     --non-recursive org.codehaus.mojo:exec-maven-plugin:1.3.1:exec)
+  echo CS_version: $CS_POM_VERSION
+  mkdir -p .ci-temp/
+  cd .ci-temp/
+  git clone https://github.com/checkstyle/contribution
+  cd ..
+  sed -i.'' 's/value=\"error\"/value=\"ignore\"/' \
+        .ci-temp/contribution/checkstyle-tester/checks-nonjavadoc-error.xml
+  cd .ci-temp/contribution/checkstyle-tester
+  sed -i '/  <!-- Filters -->/r ../../../.ci/openjdk14-excluded.files' checks-nonjavadoc-error.xml
+  export MAVEN_OPTS="-Xmx2048m"
+  groovy ./launch.groovy --listOfProjects ../../../.ci/openjdk-projects-to-test-on.config \
